Articles.Content: I was just browsing on imgur and came across this pic and though ppl would like it. It really gives a new perspective on how large the universe is.
You need to caption it to give it scale. Every point on there is a galaxy cluster.
Every time I see that image I think about the gaps the dark spaces... imagine how lonely you'd be there.
Looks more like a drawing of neurons to me
That bright spot in the center... is that the great attractor? And the formation in the upper left, is that the great wall?

Wait, did this come out of COSMOS?

Looks familiar.

Looks more like a drawing of neurons to me

Its amazingly similar to pictures of neurones!

Actually, one time Hubble looked into an empty space that is empty to the naked eye, and found hundreds of galaxies.

That gives more of a sense of scale to me.

Its amazingly similar to pictures of neurones!

There are a couple of other structures it resembles. Large or small do not seem to matter that much in nature.
This picture comes from a simulation of the universe performed on a super-computer by a university. It took 3 months (I think), to simulate 10 billion particles, each with a gravitational factor.

Oddly reminds me of the brain structure lol

Is it in 3d? I don't really know how to look at it
I don't see any perspective of how large the universe is in the picture. Some more context, maybe?
